channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: sports
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: sports

item.title: SMU knocks off No. 10 Miami 26-20 in overtime, damaging playoff hopes for Hurricanes
item.description: DALLAS (AP) — SMU is still finding a way to affect the Atlantic Coast Conference race even after losing an ACC regular-season game for the first time and falling out of the College Football Playoff picture. T.J. Harden scored on a 1-yard run in overtime, and the Mustangs upset No.
item.dc:creator: SCHUYLER DIXON, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: 49ers flex Clelin Ferrell from practice squad, he and Keion White should face Giants
item.description: Trade acquisition Keion White, practice squad player Clelin Ferrell expected to both face Giants for 49ers.
item.dc:creator: Jerry McDonald, The Mercury News

item.title: Sayin has 4 TD throws, top-ranked Ohio State takes control in 2nd half for 38-14 win over Penn State
item.description: COLUMBUS, Ohio (AP) — Ohio State's defense received plenty of attention entering Saturday's game against Penn State, especially with former defensive coordinator Jim Knowles coming back to Ohio Stadium.
item.dc:creator: JOE REEDY, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Ex-MLB pitcher Yoervis Medina dead at 37 after reportedly suffering heart attack while driving in Venezuela
item.description: Former MLB pitcher Yoervis Medina died after reportedly suffering a heart attack while driving in Venezuela. The Seattle Mariners reliever had a 3.08 career ERA over three seasons.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Sebastian Coe pushes for a cross-country running race at the 2030 Winter Olympics
item.description: Sebastian Coe would love to see a cross-country running race brought back to the Olympics at the 2030 Winter Games.
item.dc:creator: Doug Feinberg, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Manning throws 3 touchdowns and No. 20 Texas holds off No. 9 Vanderbilt late for 34-31 win
item.description: Texas quarterback Arch Manning returned from a concussion to lead the No. 20 Longhorns to a 34-31 victory over No. 9 Vanderbilt.
item.dc:creator: Jim Vertuno, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Fan waving American flag storms field in Game 6 of World Series, sparking boos from Canadian crowd
item.description: A fan with an American flag disrupted World Series Game 6 between Dodgers and Blue Jays before getting tackled by security during the sixth inning.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Oilers play the Blackhawks after Nurse's 2-goal showing
item.description: The Edmonton Oilers host the Chicago Blackhawks after Darnell Nurse's two-goal game against the New York Rangers in the Oilers' 4-3 overtime loss. Story Chicago Blackhawks (5-4-2, in the Central Division) vs. Edmonton Oilers (5-4-3, in the Pacific Division) Edmonton, Alberta; Saturday, 9 p.m.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Dodgers force World Series to deciding Game 7 by holding off Blue Jays 3-1 as Yamamoto wins again
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — A two-run lead was starting to slip away from the Los Angeles Dodgers in the ninth inning — along with their chance to force the World Series to Game 7.
item.dc:creator: RONALD BLUM, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Buccaneers hope to get injured players back soon as tough stretch awaits after bye week
item.description: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers overcame several injuries to key players and kept winning in the first half of their season.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: 100 days until the Italy Olympics: What to expect from the opening ceremonies
item.description: As of Wednesday, the Milan-Cortina Winter Olympic Games are officially 100 days away. Those who have visited Italy or watched coverage of the 2006 Torino games likely expect dramatic backdrops and Italian cultural charm sprinkled throughout the games.
item.dc:creator: Bill Disbrow, NewsNation

item.title: Questionable officiating outshines Bucs win in New Orleans
item.description: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers left New Orleans with a dominant 23-3 victory over the Saints, but a pair of questionable calls by NFL officials kept it from being even worse for the home team.
item.dc:creator: Garrett Phillips, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Fan at Penguins game hospitalized after falling from upper concourse
item.description: PITTSBURGH (AP) — A fan at Monday night's game between the Pittsburgh Penguins and St. Louis Blues was taken to a hospital after falling from the upper concourse at PPG Paints Arena. The incident happened early in the first period after Anthony Mantha's goal gave the Penguins a 2-0 lead.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Catching, running and stopping the football: 3 Takeaways from the Bears' loss in Baltimore
item.description: The Chicago Bears' offense struggled against the Ravens, but Rome Odunze was a bright spot, while the defense was unable to rely on turnovers to win, and D'Andre Swift needs to find success running inside the tackles to contribute to winning football games.
item.dc:creator: Eli Ong, WGN 9

item.title: Mammoth extend win streak to seven with 3-2 win at Winnipeg
item.description: SALT LAKE CITY (ABC4 Sports) - The Utah Mammoth are on a roll like they've never been on before. Dylan Guenther broke a tie with 5:36 remaining in the third period, lifting the Utah Mammoth to their seventh straight win, 3-2 against the Winnipeg Jets at Canada Life Centre on Sunday.
item.dc:creator: Dana Greene, ABC 4

item.title: Laferriere and Fiala score in 2nd-period burst to back Forsberg in Kings' 3-1 win over Blackhawks
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — Alex Laferriere and Kevin Fiala scored in a 1:25 span early in the second period, Anton Forsberg stopped 22 shots and the Los Angeles Kings beat the Chicago Blackhawks 3-1 on Sunday night Coming off a 5-4 shootout loss Saturday night in Nashville, the Kings ended a string of four extr
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Michael Brennan wins Bank of Utah Championship
item.description: IVINS, Utah (ABC4 Sports) - Michael Brennan was just as dominant at Black Desert as he was on the PGA Tour Americas. He closed with a 5-under 66 to go from a sponsor exemption to a PGA Tour winner Sunday with his four-shot victory in the Bank of Utah Championship.
item.dc:creator: Dana Greene, ABC 4

item.title: Anthony Nelson and the Buccaneers' defense shine in a 23-3 victory over the struggling Saints
item.description: ampa Bay edge rusher Anthony Nelson had an interception for a touchdown to go with a forced fumble and two sacks, Sean Tucker ran for a 1-yard score on fourth down and the Buccaneers beat the hapless New Orleans Saints 23-3 on Sunday.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Mistake-prone Bears stumble in Baltimore, fumble opportunity to steal road victory at Ravens
item.description: BALTIMORE, Md. (WGN) — As it is often said, the NFL is a week-to-week league. And after five weeks of building positive momentum, the Chicago Bears took a step back in a loss at the Baltimore Ravens on Sunday.
item.dc:creator: Eli Ong, WGN 9

item.title: Jury: NCAA to pay $18M to former football player, his wife in concussion lawsuit
item.description: The NCAA owes a former college football player and his wife $18 million, a South Carolina jury decided while finding college sports’ major governing body negligent in failing to warn the player about the long-term effects of concussions.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Kucherov gets 1,000th career point in Lightning's game against Ducks
item.description: TAMPA, Fla. (AP) — Nikita Kucherov became the third-fastest active player to reach the 1,000-point club, reaching the milestone Saturday in the Tampa Bay Lightning's 4-3 win against the Anaheim Ducks. Kucherov finished with two assists and reached milestone in his 809th career game.
item.dc:creator: ERIK ERLENDSSON, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: BYU keeps rolling with 41-27 win at Iowa State
item.description: AMES, Iowa (ABC4 Sports) - There was no letdown after the rivalry game this time. Bear Bachmeier threw for 307 yards and two touchdowns, both to Parker Kingston, as the 11th-ranked Cougars came from 14 points down to beat Iowa State Saturday afternoon, 41-27.
item.dc:creator: Dana Greene, ABC 4
